frontmatter.title: An Analysis of Rate Your Music Users and Music Era Preferences

children.value:
Rate Your Music is a website that allows users to give a 0-5 star score on music that they have listened to. 
This is [Rate Your Music](https://rateyourmusic.com/)(My reference)
All data was scraped from Rate Your Music on October 12, 2021(Data is outdated past that point)

import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import numpy as np
from mpl_toolkits.mplot3d import Axes3D
This code is required to extract the year for each albums release from the original format within the csv file

album_rankings = pd.read_csv("rym_top_5000_all_time.csv")
album_rankings['Release Date'] = pd.to_datetime(album_rankings['Release Date'], infer_datetime_format=True, format='mixed')
album_rankings['Year'] =album_rankings['Release Date'].dt.year

  album_rankings['Release Date'] = pd.to_datetime(album_rankings['Release Date'], infer_datetime_format=True, format='mixed')

children.value:
def separate_by_decade(df):
    # Ensure 'Year' column is treated as integers
    df['Year'] = pd.to_numeric(df['Year'], errors='coerce').fillna(0).astype(int)
    
    # Create a new column 'Decade' to store the decade information
    df['Decade'] = (df['Year'] // 10) * 10

    # Group by decade and aggregate the years into lists
    result = df.groupby('Decade')['Year'].agg(list).reset_index()

    return result
This code allows for all albums released in the same year to be grouped together and the average rating to be calculated from them for that year
This code allows for all albums released in the same year to be grouped together and counted

Running this code results in this 3d-graph which depicts the specific year, the number of albums in the year, and the average rating of all the albums released in the year. Unfortunatley I was unable to incorporate an interactive 3d graph I had previously created within this myst page.

children.value: This data indicates that differences in average album rating between years aren’t substantially different with the highest average rating for a decade being 3.802(1960s) and the lowest being 3.730(2020s). However there is a correlation with the albums slowly reducing in average rating past the 1960s. As this data was scraped from late 2021 there is a good chance that the average rating for the 2020s is misrepresntative of the current average rating.
